The Earl of Balfour, K.G.,O.M.SirM'^A. Hankey, G.O.secretary. (This Document is^ the Property of His. Britannio^agesTy' s &oyef ranenT.'')SECRET -CABINET 13 (25).CONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the Cabinet,held at 10, Downing Street, S.W. 1, onWEDNESDAY, MARCH 4, 192 5, at 11-30 a.m.INETOOBDURE.1. The Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs and deputy Leader of the House of Commons informed theCabinet that the Prime Minister was unable to attend the Cabinet, having left London owing to the illnessof his mother, and had asked him to take the Chair.-1- EilETA PROTOCOLSECURITY.Iference:t&inet 12I), Con-iision 1. J2. The Cabinet had before them the samedocuments as those mentioned in tho Conclusionsof the preceding Meeting with the addition ofthe following:-a draft telegram to the Dominionsprepared by the Secretary of Statefor the Colonies.(Paper CP. 134(25)).Revised paragraphs prepared Toy the earl of Balfour in substitution for those following the third paragraph of Section T of hisdraft despatch.(C.I.D. Paper 589-B).The discussion occupied the whole ofthe Meeting and was then adjourned until 5.30 p.m,on the same day. As a matter of convenience thewhole of the Conclusions are recorded in theMinutes of this latter Meeting.2, Whitehall Gardens, S.W.1.,March 4, 1925,
